E8x4_Parity_32D.description: Four E8 parity blocks (Leech/A/D/E) each paired with its mirror; forward & reverse words inverse up to conjugacy.
E8x4_Parity_32D.notes: Use as 32D stable workspace; lowest dispersion on Leech.

KQPL_192D.description: Klein-Quad Parity Lattice: mirrored 96D halves; four Klein routes × two halves = eight channels around an E8 spine.
KQPL_192D.notes: Unilaterally binary; any E8 insertion self-solves or is rejected with receipts.

Wrapper_384D_14plus2.description: Meta-shell with 14 Weyl/Monster-aligned portals + 2 solve rails (forward/back).
Wrapper_384D_14plus2.notes: Portals commute with parity-torus; Δφ monotone under portal use.

portal_invariants.name: Parity-Torus Closure
portal_invariants.statement: Every lawful move must close a 6-segment LR π/4 torus loop before commit.
portal_invariants.evidence: Observed closure across all scales; Δφ_cycle≤0 with receipts.

portal_invariants.name: Δφ Monotonicity
portal_invariants.statement: Potential functional Δφ must be non-increasing along any accepted route, including reflections.

portal_invariants.name: Anchor Identity
portal_invariants.statement: Forward/mirror executions preserve anchor hashes at closure.
portal_invariants.evidence: Leech rails show minimal dispersion; mirrors match hashes.

portal_invariants.name: Residuals-as-Programs
portal_invariants.statement: Remainders encode the next legal route as a reduced word; no heuristic choices required.
portal_invariants.evidence: Stubborn items close after E8 straightening with minimal programs.

portal_invariants.name: Two-Rail Lawfulness
portal_invariants.statement: Solve rail and governance rail are co-equal; both must be receipts-legal per step.
portal_invariants.evidence: Negative rails logged; closures require both rails consistent.

portal_invariants.name: Compactification Cone
portal_invariants.statement: Moves leaving the lawful cone (Π, BW32) are reflected into the dominant chamber.
portal_invariants.evidence: All excursions corrected by snap-back; no illegal commits recorded.

portal_invariants.name: Least-Action Selection
portal_invariants.statement: Among routes with identical receipts, choose the shortest legal word.
portal_invariants.evidence: E-hybrid channels often chosen when words shorten without Δφ increase.

portal_invariants.name: Family Orthogonality
portal_invariants.statement: Leech, A, D, E channels act as orthogonal rails; cross-family detours must not raise Δφ.
portal_invariants.evidence: Cross-family closures keep Δφ stable; Leech dispersion lowest.

portal_invariants.name: 64-Bit ECC Locality
portal_invariants.statement: Single-site contradictions are repaired at the 64-bit tile before escalation.
portal_invariants.evidence: Row/column and cross-family parity fix most faults locally.

portal_invariants.name: 10-Segment Composite
portal_invariants.evidence: No alternate composite preserves both Δφ and anchor identity.

portal_invariants.name: Klein Wave Pre-Solve
portal_invariants.statement: Non-orientable wave routes may pre-stamp anchors at lower Δφ prior to visible interaction.
portal_invariants.evidence: 96D triads show provisional anchors that match final closures.

portal_invariants.name: Octave Palindrome
portal_invariants.statement: 16D bodies are palindromic; forward/mirror rails glue at a central fixed point.
portal_invariants.evidence: 4096-term octaves preserve identity; palindromic receipts recorded.

portal_invariants.name: Portal Commutativity
portal_invariants.statement: Any successful portal sequence has a mirrored twin with identical Δφ_cycle and anchor hash.
portal_invariants.evidence: 14-DOF wrapper sequences pairwise agree under mirroring.

portal_invariants.name: E8 Autogenesis
portal_invariants.statement: Any lawful expansion that preserves receipts decomposes into products of E8 rails.
